page.title: 06A HISTORY OF ROCKPORT II
page.content: Within the last twenty years some stables have been converted into an assembly hall,a cow byre into a small gymnasium and then into an art room when a large sports hall was built, trees have been removed to make space for an all-weather games pitch and many prefabricated buildings have been erected to provide extra classroom accommodation and dining room facilities. Over the years ,much of the land that went with the house has been sold off to neighbouring concerns such as Glencraig Community (q.v.)and Glencraig Primary School. Fortunately , the main house is now a listed building so it will always maintain its beautiful Georgian elegance.
